abstract: Dell has spent more on share repurchases than it earned throughout its life as a public company, and most of those repurchases were at prices well above current levels.
snippet: Dell has spent more on share repurchases than it earned throughout its life as a public company, and most of those repurchases were at prices well above current levels.
lead_paragraph: It was an amazing American success story, in which a college student in his dorm room created what became one of the largest computer companies in the world. In the 1990s, its share price tripled in each of three consecutive years. But after the bubble burst, it resorted to accounting fraud to persuade investors it was doing better than it really was.

headline.main: Dell’s Ups and Downs With Options
headline.print_headline: Dell’s Ups and Downs With Options
